faq_page.meta_description: Find answers to common questions about buying, importing, and repairing vehicles with SUM Trading.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Have questions? We have answers. If you can't find what you're looking for, feel free to contact us.
faq.no_results: We didn't find any questions matching your search.
faq.whatsapp_message: Hello! I have a question that I didn't find in the FAQ.

questions.question: What does your 'turnkey' service include?
questions.answer:
Our comprehensive service covers the entire import process. Here is the breakdown:

  • Search and Advice: We advise you and look for the best opportunities.
  • Purchase and Representation: We represent you at the auction to get the best price.
  • Logistics and Transport: We coordinate maritime shipping.
  • Customs and Paperwork: We manage all export and import documentation.
  • Repair and Final Delivery: We offer repair services and deliver the vehicle to your country, ready to use.

questions.question: Where can I see available vehicles?
questions.answer: We are brokers for the main US auction portals. You can see the available inventory directly in our search engine. If you find a vehicle of interest, send it to us to start the advisory process.

questions.question: How does the auction advisory service work?
questions.answer:
Our advisory service allows you to participate in US auctions using our broker license, even if you don't have one. The process is simple:

  1. Activate the service: You pay a one-time activation fee of $20 USD.
  2. Get advice: A SUM expert will contact you to analyze the vehicles you are interested in, verify their history with AutoCheck reports, and define a bidding strategy.
  3. Participate in the auction: We bid for you up to the limit you establish.
  4. Keep your fee: If you don't win the auction, your $20 USD fee remains as credit for a next attempt, at no additional cost.

questions.question: Can I visit the vehicle before buying it?
questions.answer:
Vehicles are located in auction yards in the United States, so it is not possible to physically visit them before purchase. However, we offer:

  • Detailed AutoCheck reports with the vehicle's complete history
  • High-quality photos from multiple angles
  • Detailed damage description provided by the auction
  • Personalized advice from our experts to evaluate the vehicle's condition

questions.question: What happens if the vehicle has more damage than indicated?
questions.answer:
If upon receiving the vehicle in our yard we discover damage not reported in the auction:

  1. We notify you immediately with photos and documentation
  2. We offer you options: proceed with the purchase with a discount, cancel and receive a refund, or look for another vehicle
  3. In case of cancellation, you keep your advisory fee for your next purchase

Our priority is your satisfaction and total transparency.

questions.question: How much time do I have to decide if I buy a vehicle?
questions.answer:
Once you identify a vehicle of interest:

  • We provide you with complete information within 24 hours
  • You have until the auction date to decide (usually 1-7 days)
  • We recommend deciding at least 24 hours in advance to prepare the bidding strategy
  • We can make pre-auction offers if the seller accepts early offers

questions.question: Can I participate in multiple auctions at once?
questions.answer:
Absolutely! With your active advisory fee you can:

  • Participate in multiple auctions simultaneously
  • Receive advice for several vehicles at no additional cost
  • Get up to 3 AutoCheck reports included
  • Keep your fee until you win an auction

You only pay service fees when you win the auction.

questions.question: What are the fees and commissions?
questions.answer:
Our fees are transparent and structured according to the vehicle's value:

  • Initial Fee of $20 USD: To activate the advisory service.
  • Variable Service Fee: Starts at $200 USD for vehicles up to $3,999 and increases progressively. For example, $400 for vehicles from $4,000 to $5,999.

International shipping cost and import taxes are quoted separately.

questions.question: What payment methods do you accept?
questions.answer:
The initial $20 USD fee for advisory is paid securely on our website with a credit or debit card via Stripe. For other payments, we accept:

  • PayPal - Secure international payment
  • Cryptocurrencies - Bitcoin, Ethereum, USDT
  • Bank Transfer - International
  • US Bank Deposit - For clients in the USA

questions.question: Are there hidden costs besides the mentioned fees?
questions.answer:
There are no hidden costs. The total cost includes:

  • Vehicle price at auction
  • Auction house fees (buyer's fee)
  • Our service fee (based on vehicle price)
  • International transport (quoted separately)
  • Import taxes (according to your country)

We provide you with a complete breakdown before proceeding with any purchase.

questions.question: When should I make the payments?
questions.answer:
The payment process is structured as follows:

  1. Advisory fee ($20 USD): Upon activating the service
  2. Vehicle deposit: Within 24-48 hours after winning the auction
  3. Final vehicle payment: Before it leaves the auction yard
  4. Transport payment: Before starting international shipping
  5. Import expenses: At the time of customs clearance in your country

questions.question: What happens if I cannot complete the payment?
questions.answer:
If problems arise completing the payment:

  • Contact us immediately
  • We can coordinate payment extensions with the auction house (subject to availability)
  • If you cannot proceed, the deposit could be lost according to auction policies
  • We help you find financing solutions in some cases

Important: Only bid in auctions if you are sure you can complete the payment.

questions.question: Do you offer financing plans?
questions.answer:
We currently do not offer direct financing, but we can:

  • Recommend financial institutions in your country
  • Coordinate payments in short terms (evaluated case by case)
  • Accept partial payments during the import process

Contact our team to explore options according to your particular situation.

questions.question: Do you deliver to my city/country?
questions.answer:
We ship internationally to most Latin American countries. The most common destinations are:

  • Mexico - Door to door delivery
  • Colombia - To main port
  • Ecuador - To main port
  • Peru - To main port
  • Chile - To main port

For other countries, contact us to check availability and costs.

questions.question: What documents do I need for importation in my country?
questions.answer:
The basic documents we provide are:

  • Bill of Sale - Purchase invoice
  • Vehicle Title - Legal ownership
  • Bill of Lading - For maritime transport
  • Commercial Invoice - For customs

Additional requirements vary by country. We advise you according to your specific destination.

questions.question: How long does the entire import process take?
questions.answer:
The total time varies by destination:

  • Auction purchase: 1-7 days
  • Arrival at our yard: 3-7 days
  • Repairs (if applicable): 1-4 weeks
  • Maritime transport: 2-4 weeks
  • Customs clearance: 3-7 days

Estimated total: 4-8 weeks from purchase to final delivery.

questions.question: Is the vehicle insured?
questions.answer:
Yes, the vehicle is protected throughout the process:

  • In the auction yard: Auction house insurance
  • Inland transport in USA: Transport insurance
  • Maritime transport: International marine insurance
  • During repairs: Our workshop insurance

You can purchase additional coverage if you wish.

questions.question: What happens if the vehicle suffers damage during transport?
questions.answer:
In the unlikely event of damage during transport:

  1. We document the damage immediately with photos and reports
  2. We initiate the insurance claim process
  3. We keep you informed at every step
  4. The insurance covers damages according to the contracted policy

We work with reliable carriers to minimize any risk.

questions.question: What type of repairs can you perform?
questions.answer:
Our workshop in Texas can perform:

  • Body repair - Dents, scratches, panel replacement
  • General mechanics - Engine, transmission, suspension
  • Electrical system - Electronics and wiring
  • Professional painting - Touch-up or full paint
  • Interior restoration - Upholstery and components

We provide you with a detailed quote before starting any repair.

questions.question: Can I ship the vehicle directly without repairs?
questions.answer:
Of course! You can choose:

  • No repairs: We ship the vehicle as you bought it
  • Basic repairs: Only what is necessary for it to run
  • Complete repairs: Total restoration

You decide what level of work you want according to your budget and plans for the vehicle.

questions.question: Do you offer a warranty on repairs?
questions.answer:
Yes, all our repairs include:

  • 30-day warranty on labor
  • Manufacturer's warranty on new parts (varies by brand)
  • Photographic documentation of the work performed
  • Post-delivery support for any inquiries

We use only quality parts and certified technicians.

questions.question: How long do repairs take?
questions.answer:
Time depends on the type of repair:

  • Minor repairs: 3-7 days
  • Moderate repairs: 1-2 weeks
  • Major repairs: 2-4 weeks
  • Complete restoration: 4-8 weeks

We provide you with an estimated timeline and regular updates during the process.

questions.question: What is AutoCheck and why is it important?
questions.answer:
AutoCheck is a detailed vehicle history report that includes:

  • Accident history - Reported incidents
  • Title history - Salvage, rebuilt, clean, etc.
  • Odometer reading - Mileage verification
  • Service history - Registered maintenance
  • Previous use - Personal, rental, fleet, etc.

It is essential to make an informed decision before bidding.

questions.question: What does it mean for a vehicle to have a salvage/rebuilt title?
questions.answer:
Title types indicate the vehicle's history:

  • Clean Title: No major damage history
  • Salvage Title: Declared total loss by insurer, requires repair
  • Rebuilt Title: Was salvage, repaired and inspected, can circulate
  • Parts Only: Only for parts, cannot circulate

We advise you on which title types you can legalize in your country.

questions.question: Can I legalize any vehicle in my country?
questions.answer:
Regulations vary by country:

  • Mexico: Allows most titles with special procedures
  • Colombia: Restrictions by year and title type
  • Ecuador: Specific import regulations
  • Other countries: Check local regulations

We advise you on the viability of legalization before buying.

questions.question: Where are you located?
questions.answer:
We have binational presence to serve you better:

  • Brownsville, Texas (USA) - Main operations yard and workshop
  • Pachuca, Mexico - Administrative office and customer service

This allows us to offer the best service both in purchasing in the USA and logistics to Latin America.

questions.question: How can I be sure this is not a fraud?
questions.answer:
We understand your concern. SUM Trading has been operating since 2018 with public presence in both Mexico and the United States. Trust guarantees:

  • ✅ Broker License in US auction houses
  • ✅ Secure payment platforms like Stripe
  • ✅ Official documentation - Bill of Sale and Vehicle Title
  • ✅ Verifiable physical presence in USA and Mexico
  • ✅ Real testimonials from satisfied clients
  • ✅ Active social media with regular content

You can visit us in person or request a video call to see our facilities.
